Description: Cast weight (or game piece ?) in copper alloy; unusual shape; surface bit corroded.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Oriental Institute, University of Chicago. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
This shape is unique in Naukratis corpus of artefacts. Petrie identified it as a weight of one Egyptian Kat (Petrie 1886, 79, no. 6).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 75 and 79 no. 6, pl. XXII no. 92)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (VB.296) (phase 3)
